skill.name: obsidian-plan-wiki
skill.description: This skill should be used when creating or working with modular project plans stored as Obsidian-compatible markdown wikis. Use when the user asks to create a plan, roadmap, or documentation system that needs to be navigable in Obsidian, or when working with existing plan wikis that use the %% [ ] %% task tracking format.
skill.summary: This skill should be used when creating or working with modular project plans stored as Obsidian-com...
skill.author: Cygnusfear

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown templates and workflow guides. No executable code, no network calls, no filesystem access beyond normal AI behavior, no environment variable access, and no command execution capabilities. Contains only documentation files with templates for Obsidian-compatible project wikis.

content.value_statement: Complex projects require organized documentation that remains navigable as they grow. This skill provides templates and workflows for creating Obsidian-compatible markdown wikis with progressive disclosure, task tracking, and research integration.
actual_capabilities: Initialize modular project plans with Obsidian-compatible directory structure
Create phase and task markdown files with consistent naming conventions
Track open tasks using Obsidian comment syntax with checkboxes
Apply Delphi research pattern with parallel oracle agents for complex decisions
Maintain changelog using Keep a Changelog format for audit trail
limitations: Does not execute shell commands or scripts on the user system
Does not integrate with external APIs or third-party services
Does not provide built-in Obsidian plugin or synchronization features
Does not automate file creation outside of AI-assisted markdown generation

use_cases.title: Manage software projects
use_cases.description: Organize multi-phase software projects with task breakdowns, research notes, and phase overviews in navigable markdown format.

use_cases.title: Structure documentation systems
use_cases.description: Create documentation wikis with progressive disclosure that scales as projects grow and evolve over time.

use_cases.title: Plan product roadmaps
use_cases.description: Build roadmaps with task tracking, changelog history, and research integration for stakeholder communication.

prompt_templates.title: Start new plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new plan wiki for [project name] with [number] phases. Tech stack is [technologies]. Goal is [one sentence goal].

prompt_templates.title: Add phase
prompt_templates.prompt: Add a new phase to the existing plan. Include [number] tasks for [phase description]. Create phase file and individual task files.

prompt_templates.title: Track research
prompt_templates.prompt: Research [topic] using the Delphi pattern. Create research file in research/ directory with findings and link from relevant task.

prompt_templates.title: Complete task
prompt_templates.prompt: Complete task [[path/to/task]] by marking it as done, adding result link, and updating the changelog with proper format.

output_examples.input: Create a new plan wiki for a mobile app project with 3 phases. Tech stack is React Native and Firebase.
output: Created README.md with project overview and links
Created CLAUDE.md with progressive disclosure rules
Created phases/01-design.md with initial task breakdown
Next: Add specific tasks to phases based on requirements

best_practices: Load only files needed for current task - never load entire plan into context
Update changelog immediately when making changes - do not batch changes
Use descriptive research file names and mark research as applied with Obsidian comments
anti_patterns: Loading entire plan into context at once instead of progressive disclosure
Deleting deferred work instead of preserving it in deferred.md
Creating overly large files instead of splitting into focused task files

faq.question: What tools work with this skill?
faq.answer: The skill works with Claude and Claude Code. It provides prompts and templates for creating Obsidian-compatible markdown wikis.

faq.question: What is the file size limit?
faq.answer: There is no strict limit. The skill creates markdown files that Obsidian can handle. Large projects may have many small files for progressive disclosure.

faq.question: Does it sync with Obsidian?
faq.answer: No. The skill generates markdown files that you open in Obsidian. Sync is handled by Obsidian or your file synchronization method.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only generates markdown templates. It does not access, transmit, or store data externally. All files remain on your local system.

faq.question: Why is my plan not loading?
faq.answer: Ensure you are reading specific phase or task files rather than the entire directory. Use wiki-links provided in the files to navigate between documents.

faq.question: How does it compare to other planning tools?
faq.answer: Unlike complex project management tools, this skill creates plain markdown files that work in any editor. No vendor lock-in. Files are portable and version controllable.
